answers.answer: I'm not overweight but I would not be thinking about trying to lose weight while pregnant.   Eat healthy for baby and go on walks.

I am overweight as well. I also feel sluggish. I lost a bit of weight in the first trimester but it was due to nausea. Its not safe to "try" to lose weight while you're pregnant. If you focus on eating clean and healthy and moving more you will feel better and also set yourself up for success after the baby is born.

If you eat healthy and try to be a little active, you won't gain as much as you might if you aren't. You'll technically be losing weight because baby is gaining. But you can always call your doctor's office to ask for advice even if your appointment is that far away

This is a question I have as well as I am in the same situation at 5 weeks. I would assume that it is safe as long as the weight is being lost in a healthy manner such as proper eating and light exercise.  If you are going to work out definitely read up on the do's and don'ts before getting started. I hope to lose a safe amount of weight but am more focused on strengthening my back, legs, and arms to hopefully make the pregnancy a little easier, not to mention hauling around the little one afterwards.

In my opinion I would not try to lose weight at this point but I would try to only gain the minimum that is the safest for baby. I think you would be OK with 10 to 15 pounds. I am almost 8 months pregnant and only gained six pounds but unfortunately that is because this pregnancy I have had extreme nausea and vomiting. Also it is very common to lose wight in the beginning due to morning sickness. Well good luck!!! And I know it's easier said than done for us women but try not to worry about your figure so much. Enjoy being pregnant but don't let the pregnancy excuse lead to a crazy amount of weight gain!!! Been there done that not fun.

I have lost weight during this pregnancy due to the diet i was placed on because of gestational diabetes. Honestly i wouldnt say to be on a diet but instead make different choices i used to eat a snickers almost everynight by my second trimester I weighed 230 i started substituting snickers for fruit with greek yogurt i cut out everything to drink except water and lowered carb intake also added snacking into my diet in between my 3 meals ive lost 15lbs but I wouldnt do it for weightloss i would do it to feel better im now 35 weeks have alot of energy and never feel hungry. I would always check with your doctor ofcourse and dont stress about the scale the most important thing is that your baby is getting all the nutrients needed :) goodluck.

No it's not good to purposely lose weight while pregnant any doctor will tell you that. it's not good for baby. The only thing you can do it eat healthy and go walking. That will keep you from gain a bunch a weight making it easier to get pregnancy weight.

I am overweight as well, my doctor told me it was unsafe to purposely lose weight.  That being said I did lose weight my first trimester but that was due to severe nausea  (hyperemesis Gravidvarium to be exact). Now in second trimester I am gaining weight but not a lot. My doctor gave me a safe amount that she wants me to try to stick to for weight gain  (10-15 lbs). She also said to go walking to help maintain that.

I weighed 270 at 36 years old when I started out my pregnancy with my daughter.  I lost around 12 pounds during the pregnancy.   But I lost more inches than pounds.  I had a job as a waitress up until about two weeks until due date.  I was perfectly healthy the whole pregnancy.   Due to eating healthy and staying active at work I didn't even have gestational diabetes.   I delivered an 8 pound 7 1/2 oz. Baby girl naturally.  The day after I delivered, I was curious to see what I weighed.  It was 230.  Don't be too concerned about what you weigh, be concerned about what your numbers are saying.  Blood pressure.  Sugar.  Etc.  Eat healthy and try to be active.  That is the most important thing.

You are not supposed to try to lose weight while your pregnant. If you are overweight your doctor may put you on a diet in order to maintain your current weight during pregnancy and to try to prevent gestational diabetes, but it is unhealthy to try to lose weight during pregnancy. Just eat healthy foods and do some light exercise like walking for 30 minutes every day.

question: I'm wondering, is it safe for me to lose weight? I won't be seeing my dr again for another 3 weeks to ask. Since my first appt 6 weeks ago I have lost about 8 pounds. I feel very sluggish and huge. I would really like to lose a little more weight so that way I'm not suffering during my last trimester. Anyone else experience an overweight problem while pregnant? What did you do to make your body feel better? I weigh 230 pounds
title: Overweight and 11 wks pregnant.
